item.title: EU ends Apple Pay antitrust probe with binding commitments to open up contactless payments
item.description:
The European Union has accepted commitments from Apple over how it operates Apple Pay to settle a long running competition investigation. Commission EVP Margrethe Vestager, who heads up the EU’s competition division, announced the development in a press conference Thursday. Apple has until July 25 to implement changes that will allow developers of rival mobile […]

item.title: Joby Aviation is betting on hydrogen-electric aircraft for regional flight
item.description:
Joby Aviation is still a year away from commercially launching its electric air taxi designed for urban environments, but the startup is already looking towards its next chapter: Intercity flight, powered by hydrogen.  To get the conversation started with regulators and demonstrate hydrogen’s capabilities, Joby told TechCrunch that it completed a 523-mile test flight with […]

item.title: Sekai secures Naruto’s license to develop consumer apps for anime fans
item.description:
Just like in your favorite anime, this is the story of a young group of twenty-something who started with nothing, traveled the world and ended up with a global license to develop official Naruto consumer apps. Originally founded in early 2022, French startup Sekai describes itself as a studio that wants to create entertainment experiences […]

item.title: Apple reaches deal with EU regulators to open up mobile payments system to rivals - CNBC
item.description:
1. Apple reaches deal with EU regulators to open up mobile payments system to rivals  CNBC
  2. Apple Avoids EU Antitrust Threat With Tap-and-Pay Probe Settlement  Bloomberg
  3. European Union accepts Apple's pledge to let rivals access 'tap to pay' iPhone tech to resolve antitrust case  ABC News
  4. EU Accepts Apple Plan To Open IPhone Tap-to-pay To Rivals  Barron's
  5. Apple, EU Settle Long-Running Antitrust Probe  The Wall Street Journal

item.title: South Korean experts unlock the power of air and salt in breakthrough battery science: 'A much higher discharge potential'
China’s businesses are ‘noticeably ahead’ of the rest of the world when it comes to adopting AI—and preparing for the inevitable regulations
